target_markets.market_description: Gamers and casual mobile game players
demographics: people who play games like Candy Crush
pain_points: paying for in-game items they don't actually own
not being compensated for time spent gaming
target_markets.market_size_indicators: 90% of people will not play games unless properly valued for their time

target_markets.market_description: People building online identities and participating in digital communities
pain_points: lack of ownership over digital identity
disconnect between online and offline value
target_markets.market_size_indicators: everyone will participate in a DAO within 5 years

problems_validated.problem: Gamers are not properly compensated for their time and are being exploited
problems_validated.severity: high - affects 90% of game players according to prediction
problems_validated.current_solutions: traditional mobile games with ad revenue models and in-app purchases
problems_validated.market_gap: players don't own what they buy and aren't compensated for their time investment

problems_validated.problem: People care more about online identity than offline but aren't properly valued for it
problems_validated.severity: growing trend that will become mainstream
problems_validated.market_gap: lack of ownership and proper valuation of online identity and participation

products_tools.name: On-chain games
products_tools.use_case: play-to-earn gaming that properly values player time

products_tools.name: Candy Crush
products_tools.pricing: free with ads and in-app purchases

business_strategies.strategy: Play-to-earn model where users earn value instead of being harvested
business_strategies.implementation: build on-chain games that compensate players for time spent
business_strategies.expected_results: players become the harvester instead of the harvested
business_strategies.case_study: contrasted with current Candy Crush model

business_strategies.strategy: Focus on user experience over branding in DAO participation
business_strategies.implementation: make DAO participation seamless so users don't even know they're in a DAO

problems_solutions.problem: Traditional games exploit players' time without compensation
problems_solutions.solution: Create on-chain equivalent games that are just as fun but provide actual value to players
steps: ensure games are as engaging as traditional alternatives

startup_ideas.idea: On-chain gaming platform that replaces traditional mobile games
startup_ideas.target_market: current mobile game players, especially casual gamers
startup_ideas.problem_solved: players not being compensated for time spent gaming
startup_ideas.business_model: play-to-earn mechanics where players earn cryptocurrency or tokens

startup_ideas.idea: User-friendly DAO platform with invisible UX
startup_ideas.validation: everyone will participate in DAOs within 5 years

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Not properly valuing user time in gaming
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: users will abandon your platform for play-to-earn alternatives
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: implement fair compensation mechanisms for user engagement
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Candy Crush model will become obsolete

growth_tactics.tactic: Make DAO participation invisible through superior UX
steps: focus on user experience over branding

metrics_kpis.benchmark: users should earn value for time spent

trends_signals.trend: Online identity becoming more valuable than offline identity
trends_signals.opportunity: build platforms that properly value and monetize online identity
90% of gamers will demand compensation for their time within 5 years
everyone will participate in DAOs within 5 years, mostly unknowingly

actionable_quotes.context: discussing why DAO adoption will be successful
actionable_quotes.actionability: prioritize UX over technical complexity or branding

actionable_quotes.quote: you will actually value your time properly
actionable_quotes.actionability: build products that properly compensate users for their time

actionable_quotes.quote: you will be the harvester instead of the harvesty
actionable_quotes.context: describing the shift from being exploited to earning value
actionable_quotes.actionability: flip traditional models to empower users rather than exploit them

key_statistics.statistic: 90% of people will not play a game unless they are being properly valued for that time
Everyone will participate in a DAO in 5 years
key_statistics.context: prediction about DAO adoption through improved UX
